alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Cape May; Cumberland (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 12 at 6:55PM EDT until July 12 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ATLANTIC...SOUTHEASTERN CUMBERLAND AND NORTHWESTERN CAPE MAY COUNTIES... At 654 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Dorothy to Leesburg to near Fortesque, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Vineland, Cumberland, Somers Point, Woodbine, Estell Manor, Corbin City, Mauricetown, Leesburg, Belleplain Forest, English Creek, Port Norris, Seaville, Dorothy, Dennisville, Bricksboro, Goshen, Port Elizabeth, Bivalve, Eldora and Beesleys Point. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 11 and 12, and between mile markers 29 and 30. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
